text: My guess is that people don't see an issue with helping people on slack. For those that want to ask on discourse, the topic is available there now, right?

text: Everyone is generally very generous about helping on Slack. But look at it from the other perspective: Some (actually I hope it's most) of us who are looking for help want to do our due diligence and try to help ourselves before we ask. It's makes better use of the valuable resource that folks like you supply and is just good citizenship IMO. Slack having less than 2 weeks of history (last I checked) makes it so that it's pretty useless in that regard.

text: As an answer-seeker, I often prefer to read an answer that's been written already rather than having to wait a day for someone in a different time zone to have time for my question. Chat is considered a lower-latency medium, but it's actually higher latency than not needing to have a conversation at all.
